page.title: 13SAFFRON GARDENS FARM.
page.content: The farm gets its name from the crop Saffron,which was grown in the fields.Monks used to live in the Monastery on the farm.The Monastery has now fallen down.Mr.Mee the present farmer says that the farm has been in the family since 1924 (61years.)There are 190 Hectores approx in 26 fields.There are 4 full time workers and 1 part time,with three from the Mee family.The farm is arable,growing wheat,barley,potatoes,peas and vegetables.There are 8 tractors,a combine harvester,potato harvester, ploughs,cultivators,drills,sprayers, and irrigators. Bullocks are fed on the farm in winter to eat the straw and haulm.They have 5 geese and 2 dogs to act as alarms.There are 11 barns,and 4 public footpaths cross the farm.
